body_html:
I'm afraid this is not something where I have advice to offer what to do in PyTorch.
Personally, I don't think the choice of std matters much beyond the NaNs, so there is an argument for using biased std. xNorm seems like a hack to me, so I would not care whether the outputs are scaled by, say 33/32 in one framework or another. Aggregating properly over multiple cards might be good to have (if it isn't done yet, it well might be), but I only have one card, so I wouldn't know if it matters in practice.
But again, I don't make that call.
